image.altText: The outside of a building with a large "Canberra Hospital'' sign.

props.synopsis: Canberra Health Services walks back a proposal to block non-ACT residents from accessing specialist medical appointments at the Canberra Hospital, as part of its plan to reduce massive patient backlogs.

title.children: Low category patients on dermatology waitlist 'unlikely' to be seen, ACT health minister concedes

image.altText: an elderly woman looking at the camera

props.synopsis: A NSW police officer tells a jury she attempted twice to grab a knife out of Clare Nowland's hands in the moments before the aged care resident was tasered by her colleague Senior Constable Kristian White.

title.children: 'I thought I was going to be stabbed': Police officer tells court of failed attempts to disarm 95yo

image.altText: High Court of Australia

props.synopsis: Last year, the High Court found indefinite immigration detention was not legal. Now, two additional cases related to that decision have been heard.

title.children: High Court urged to find government illegally detained two men for too long

image.altText: A high school aged boy in a grey t-shirt and navy New York Yankees cap smiles.

props.synopsis: It's up to state and territory governments to fund media literacy programs in schools, and a 2023 study of young Australians found only one in four surveyed received a lesson teaching them how to work out if news stories are true in the past year.

title.children: Aaron is in year 11 and recently quit Instagram. He thinks others should do the same

image.altText: A man wearing a white cap and a black shirt with the words"ACT suicide free by 2033".

props.synopsis: John Veloudos used a combination of community support and psychological tricks to complete his first ultramarathon.

title.children: 'It just took absolutely everything': How to run an ultramarathon

image.altText: a herd of wild horses standing in the national park

props.synopsis: A NSW inquiry into the aerial shooting of wild horses in Kosciuszko National Park has recommended the practice should continue, but the chairwoman who led the inquiry's committee says the final report that has been released is "biased".

title.children: 'I am sorry to the brumbies': Inquiry chair criticises finding aerial shooting at Kosciuszko should continue

image.altText: Two women sit on council

props.synopsis: The deputy mayor says the council is "bleeding money" as it faces a $37 million operating deficit after several natural disasters, and the potential of large termination payments.

title.children: NSW South Coast council CEO resigns as union claims up to 500 jobs at risk

image.altText: A church building with a cross shrouded under branches

props.synopsis: The Catholic Church wins a High Court appeal against rulings it was vicariously liable for the actions of a priest who allegedly sexually abused a five-year-old in 1971.

title.children: Catholic Church wins High Court appeal against ruling it was vicariously liable for alleged sexual abuse by a priest

image.altText: Chef Jamie Oliver standing holding his new book wide open pretending to read it

props.synopsis: Jamie Oliver has become embroiled in controversy after criticism his new book stereotypes Indigenous Australians. Here's where it all went wrong.

title.children: Penguin didn't put Jamie Oliver's children's book through a sensitivity check. That's where it all went wrong

image.altText: Donald Trump and Joe Biden sit in the Oval Office and shake hands.

props.synopsis: Joe Biden welcomes his long-time nemesis, Donald Trump, back to the White House for an undoubtedly uncomfortable Oval Office meeting to discuss the transition of power.

title.children: 'It's a nice world today': Trump meets Biden at White House before appointing more loyalists to key roles

image.altText: Matt Gaetz wears a suit, sunglasses and white 'MAGA' baseball cap in a crowd of people.

props.synopsis: It's a decades-old White House tradition, but the meeting between Biden and Trump was nothing short of remarkable. And there were still surprises to come.

title.children: 'Welcome back': Trump's return to the Oval Office was historic, but there were surprises still to come

image.altText: Two hands hold a piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: An ASIC inquiry has been told mortgage insurance is too expensive, leading to a spike in uninsured mortgages.  Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Huge spike in uninsured home borrowers, Cbus execs apologise before senate inquiry

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 'I'm sorry': Cbus boss apologises to customers, senators at hearings today
Banking system at risk from uninsured homes

image.altText: A young Asian woman looks into the camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: After a new survey revealed half of migrant women had experienced sexual harassment in Australian workplaces, workers are speaking out and calling for change.

title.children: These women were groped at work then told it's just a 'cultural thing' in Australia

image.altText: A man carrying a kangaroo that has burned and bandaged paws.

props.synopsis: Areas that had multiple fires prior to 2019–20 had greater biodiversity losses when Black Summer fires hit compared to areas that had burnt once or not all beforehand.

title.children: Prescribed burns are used to reduce bushfire risk. A new study suggests it has the opposite effect

image.altText: A smiling blond woman

props.synopsis: Patrick Orren Stephenson, 23, has pleaded not guilty to a charge of murder after the disappearance of Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy.

title.children: Husband in courtroom to hear man accused of murdering Samantha Murphy plead not guilty

image.altText: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby wears a purple top and chain with a cross as he walks in Westminster

props.synopsis: A man who survived abuse as a child at the hands of his Anglican priest says the Church should "beg" for forgiveness after it a report revealed that the Archbishop of Canterbury had knowledge of sexual abuse at Christian camps.

title.children: Child abuse survivor says Anglican Church should have learnt from Australia's Royal Commission

image.altText: A man sits behind a large desk with multiple microphones in the background and a man speaks on a virtual call on a laptop

props.synopsis: ASIC says it has done a thorough investigation into all super funds in the country and more court action is likely.

title.children: Australian super funds put 'on notice' as ASIC says issues are widespread

image.altText: Damien Richardson speaking

props.synopsis: Former actor Damien Richardson is being investigated by Victoria Police after being filmed jokingly performing the Nazi salute at an event attended by some Neo-Nazis.

title.children: Former soap star filmed doing Nazi salute at event far-right activists attended

image.altText: A scuba diver swims alongside a giant brown undulating standalone coral.

props.synopsis: Scientists say they have discovered the world's largest coral — measuring longer than a blue whale — on an expedition in Solomon Islands.

title.children: Scientists discover 'astonishingly large' coral thought to be biggest in the world

image.altText: A bag of iv fluids in a veterinary clinic.

props.synopsis: Doctors say they've been forced to ration care as sourcing the essential medicine continues to prove a challenge.

title.children: IV vitamin drips used to make 'expensive urine' even as GPs battle shortage

image.altText: A man lays flowers outside where a man rammed his car into people

props.synopsis: President Xi Jinping has called for strict punishment of the perpetrator, about whom authorities have provided little information.

title.children: Chinese authorities clear flowers, candles as details of crash that killed 35 heavily censored

image.altText: a man smiling sitting next to a woman wearing a wedding dress

props.synopsis: The mother of paramedic Steven Tougher, who was repeatedly stabbed while at a McDonald's at Campbelltown in Sydney's south-west, confronts her son's killer in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: Mother of murdered paramedic tells killer to 'rot in hell' during emotional impact statement

image.altText: A composite picture of a woman in black-and-white and a man in colour, both looking serious.

props.synopsis: Championing higher wages is in Labor's DNA, but wage growth may not be able to overcome inflation anger if a rate cut doesn't arrive soon.

title.children: Labor is cheering on wage rises but it may not overcome inflation anger if a rate cut doesn't arrive soon

image.altText: A plume of smoke rising out of a residential district full of apartment blocks in Beirut.

props.synopsis: Hezbollah strongholds in Beirut have endured another day of Israeli bombardment, as Lebanon waited to hear details of a proposed ceasefire from the US.

title.children: Six Israeli soldiers killed in Lebanon as Beirut hit by second day of air strikes

image.altText: The side of a police car with the logo and word Police.

props.synopsis: The man and woman, both in their 60s, were found dead in a hot, dry creek bed only 2.5 kilometres from their vehicle.

title.children: 'They'd used all their water': Bodies of man and woman found in outback Queensland

image.altText: A large crocodile bound by rope being pulled off a trailer by half a dozen sanctuary staff.

props.synopsis: The 5-metre-long crocodiles, Krakatoa and Boss Hog, are being billed as the largest in captivity in Queensland after the death of colossal 5.48m Cassius this month.

title.children: Two 5m crocs billed as Queensland's largest in captivity just weeks after Cassius's death

image.altText: A satellite image of smoke blowing out of a volcano

props.synopsis: Flights in and out of Bali are resuming today after volcanic eruptions clouded parts of Indonesia with dangerous ash clouds and forced Australian airlines to cancel trips.

title.children: Bali flights are back on. But airlines are still monitoring volcanic activity

image.altText: A man looking on, seen from close up.

props.synopsis: The Sea Shepherd and Greenpeace co-founder has been detained since July, with supporters worried a move to extradite him to Japan would see him live the rest of his life in prison.

title.children: Supporters of anti-whaling activist Paul Watson dismayed as detention extended for fifth time

image.altText: A police van parked in the driveway of residential property.

props.synopsis: Police found the body of a 47-year-old woman at her Townsville home earlier this month but believe she had been dead for days. They're ramping up investigations to find who was responsible.

title.children: Detectives investigating alleged murder of Townsville woman launch command centre, targeted operation

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and skin hold one arm in her hand as she leans against a gum tree. She wears ininti beads.

props.synopsis: More than 400 Indigenous rangers attend a conference at Uluru to share important cultural and land management knowledge, focusing on themes of fire management, protecting native animals and plants, and cross culture collaboration.

title.children: Female rangers lead the way in sharing their work on country and inspiring others

image.altText: Silhouette of children in the Kimberley on a beach at sunset.

props.synopsis: Advocates call for urgent action to implement a commissioner for young people in New South Wales, with First Nations children 12 times more likely to be in out-of-home care.

title.children: 'Everything was such a shock to me': The reality behind the rising number of out-of-home children

image.altText: A man in a grey suit and a red striped tie leaves a building. Two other people are in front of him, out of focus.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian judge Gregory Geason has been sentenced to a 12-month community corrections order with 100 hours of community work for assaulting and emotionally abusing a woman.

title.children: 'You have not demonstrated any remorse': Supreme Court judge sentenced after being found guilty of assaulting woman

image.altText: fire rescue victoria fire truck at station

props.synopsis: A system used to locate and track Fire Rescue Victoria vehicles is no longer operational, with the firefighters union saying the service did not update technology in time for the 3G shutdown.

title.children: Victorian firefighters locked out of stations and truck tracking system rendered obsolete by 3G network shutdown

image.altText: A composite image of a young man singing into a microphone, a cartoon blue dog and a man with brown hair and a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: From Rage's first guest programmer to Bluey's rock frontman, get your buzzers ready, music fans — it's time for the Spicks and Specks quiz!

title.children: How well do you know Australian music? Test your knowledge with the Spicks and Specks quiz
